intro: Lastrea ctenochlaena, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, pentagonal flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically palmately lobed and covered in fine hairs. Lastrea ctenochlaena thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or forested habitats.
